translation.en: They're like, "We have a huge creativity and innovation problem."
translation.ja: ある会社は “創造力と 革新に欠けている”

translation.en: I'm like, "But you don't want to talk about vulnerability?"
translation.ja: “無防備の話はダメ？”

translation.en: No vulnerability, no creativity.
translation.ja: 無防備でなくては 創造できない

translation.en: No tolerance for failure, no innovation.
translation.ja: 失敗が許されないなら 革新はあり得ない

translation.en: It is that simple.
translation.ja: 簡単なこと

translation.en: If you're not willing to fail, you can't innovate.
translation.ja: 失敗する気がないなら 革新できない

translation.en: If you're not willing to build a vulnerable culture,
translation.ja: 無防備になる 覚悟がなければ―

translation.en: you can't create.
translation.ja: 創造できない

translation.en: It's just that simple.
translation.ja: 簡単なこと

translation.en: Inclusivity, equity, diversity.
translation.ja: 包容力　平等　多様性

translation.en: We're in the middle of really important movements right now, movements that I hope will change the world.
translation.ja: 今 世界を変えるような 社会運動が多々起きている

translation.en: Black Lives Matter, Me Too, Time's Up.
translation.ja: ＢＬＭ(黒人の命も大切)　#MeToo タイムズ･アップ

translation.en: -These are-- These are big... -[audience applauds]
translation.ja: どれも重大よ

translation.en: These are big movements.
translation.ja: 大きな運動

translation.en: Trans Lives Matter. These are movements that matter,
translation.ja: トランスジェンダーの 権利も大切

translation.en: and these are movements that have the potential to change things.
translation.ja: 世の中を変える可能性がある

translation.en: What happens is, every organization I go into right now, they say,
translation.ja: どの組織も同じことを言う

translation.en: "We don't know how to have these conversations. They're incredibly uncomfortable.
translation.ja: “対処に困っていて とても厄介だ”

translation.en: We're afraid we're gonna say the wrong thing.
translation.ja: “誤った事を言いたくない”

translation.en: We're afraid that what I say won't match my heart.
translation.ja: “思いが伝わらない”

translation.en: I'll be taken the wrong way. People will make assumptions."
translation.ja: “勘違いされる” “先入観がある”

translation.en: And so, I think there's a very clear answer here, which is,
translation.ja: ここで明らかなことは―

translation.en: first, to not have the conversations because they make you uncomfortable
translation.ja: まず― 厄介だから話さないのは 自分を特別扱いしている

translation.en: is the definition of privilege.
translation.ja: 厄介だから話さないのは 自分を特別扱いしている

translation.en: Your comfort is not at the center of this discussion.
translation.ja: あなたの不都合など 論外よ

translation.en: Like, that is not how this works.
translation.ja: 問題ではない

translation.en: It just doesn't work that way. Of course you're going to get your ass handed to you in these conversations.
translation.ja: 自分が叩かれるのは あたりまえのこと

translation.en: And the whiter, straighter, Christian,
translation.ja: 白人 ストレート キリスト教徒

translation.en: majority culture you are, the more mistakes you're gonna make.
translation.ja: 多数派ほど間違いを犯す

translation.en: It's not a question about whether you have a bias or not,
translation.ja: 偏見があるかではなく―

translation.en: it's what biases do you have, and how many, and how bad, and how deep?
translation.ja: どれだけ どれほどひどいか

translation.en: That's going to happen. That's what we sign up for when we have these conversations.
translation.ja: この会話はそういうこと

translation.en: That's how it works. And then you listen,
translation.ja: とにかく聞くこと

translation.en: and you learn, and you don't hold the people accountable.
translation.ja: 聞いて学んで 人を非難しないこと

translation.en: You know, the people who are targeted by racism and homophobia, and heterosexism, and gender bias
translation.ja: 人種差別や同性愛差別 性差別を受けている人が―

translation.en: are not responsible... for initiating these conversations and building the tables where they should be happening.
translation.ja: こういった話し合いに 参加する義務はまったくない

translation.en: -[audience applauds] -That's not-- That's not how this works.
translation.ja: そういうものではない

translation.en: We have to be able to choose courage over comfort, and we have to say, "Look...
translation.ja: 不都合でも勇気を出して 話すしかない

translation.en: I don't know that I'm gonna nail this, but I'm gonna try 'cause what I'm sure as hell not gonna do is stay quiet."
translation.ja: “しくじるかもしれないけど 黙っているよりはマシ”

translation.en: That's what we can't do.
translation.ja: 沈黙は許されない

translation.en: And so, yeah, you're gonna make a lot of mistakes. Yeah, it's gonna be uncomfortable.
translation.ja: 多くの間違いを犯し とても不快になる

translation.en: Yeah, you're gonna learn about blind spots that you didn't even know you had.
translation.ja: まったく知らなかった 盲点に気づくことになる

translation.en: And then you're gonna be grateful for that moment
translation.ja: その機会に感謝する

translation.en: and take learning it...
translation.ja: 自分から率先して 学ぼうとし―

translation.en: into your own hands, not make other people responsible for teaching it,
translation.ja: 自分から率先して 学ぼうとし― 人に任せっきりにしない

translation.en: and that's how we move forward.
translation.ja: そうやって前進する

translation.en: But if you think there's gonna be real conversation in this country or in companies or organizations
translation.ja: この国 会社 組織で 快適に話せると思う？

translation.en: around equity and-- and diversity and inclusivity...
translation.ja: この国 会社 組織で 快適に話せると思う？ 公平さや多様性 包括性について？

translation.en: while you remain comfortable,
translation.ja: 公平さや多様性 包括性について？

translation.en: that is not gonna happen. And it shouldn't happen.
translation.ja: ありえないし そうではいけない

translation.en: So when we build cultures at work, where there is zero tolerance for vulnerability,
translation.ja: 会社の文化が 無防備になることを許さず―

translation.en: where perfectionism and armor are rewarded and necessary,
translation.ja: 完璧主義をたたえ 鉄壁の守りを敷くなら―

translation.en: you can't have these conversations. They're not productive.
translation.ja: こういった会話をしてもムダ

translation.en: How many of you think, tomorrow, if I had a magic wand and I could wave it at where you work-- it's your office--
translation.ja: もし私が明日 あなたの職場で 魔法の杖を振って―

translation.en: and tomorrow morning when you walked in, everyone in that office had the capacity for difficult, productive conversation,
translation.ja: 会社の人全員と 複雑で生産的な会話をして―

translation.en: how many of you think things would change overnight? If everyone could have really hard conversations?
translation.ja: しっかり向き合えたら 状況は変わると思う？

translation.en: We can't have them. You know what we end up doing?
translation.ja: それができないから―

translation.en: We end up talking about people instead of talking to people.
translation.ja: 人と話すのではなく 人について話す

translation.en: And it's really-- It's toxic. It just takes over culture.
translation.ja: 毒のように会社にまん延する

translation.en: Giving feedback, receiving feedback, problem-solving, ethical decision-making...
translation.ja: 意見の交換 問題の解決 倫理的な決断は―

translation.en: These are all born of vulnerability.
translation.ja: 無防備な状態から生まれる

translation.en: I understand that work seems like a hard place to be vulnerable,
translation.ja: 職場で無防備になるのは 難しい

translation.en: but we spend more than half of our lives at work,
translation.ja: 人生の半分は仕事なのに

translation.en: and I've never met a single person or interviewed a single person in 20 years
translation.ja: 私はこの20年で １人も会ったことがない

translation.en: that had a joyful, wholehearted life that was miserable at work.
translation.ja: 職場で惨めでも 喜びに満ちた人なんて

translation.en: That stuff will eat you alive.
translation.ja: 心をむしばまれる

translation.en: And we all have a responsibility to show up
translation.ja: 私たちには責任がある

translation.en: and bring our whole hearts and our whole selves to work
translation.ja: 職場で心を開いて―

translation.en: and lean in to the tough conversations.
translation.ja: 難しい会話を しなければいけない

translation.en: Brave leaders are never silent around hard things.
translation.ja: 勇敢なリーダーは 難題に背を向けられない

translation.en: Our job is to excavate the unsaid.
translation.ja: 無言の沈黙を破らないと

translation.en: What is the thing that's not being said? And that requires courage and vulnerability.
translation.ja: それには勇気と 無防備になる覚悟がいる

translation.en: People ask, "Where do I start with vulnerability?" And the best place to start is dispelling the myths.
translation.ja: そのためには 社会的通念を取り払う

translation.en: So myth one: Vulnerability is weakness.
translation.ja: まずは “無防備なのは弱点”

translation.en: I've spent a lot of time evangelizing around this, and here's the thing.
translation.ja: 長い間この事を 人に問いかけた

translation.en: I've cut it down to one question. And here's the question:
translation.ja: 質問を１つに絞って 聞いてきた

translation.en: Vulnerability...
translation.ja: 無防備になるとは―

translation.en: is-- the definition of it, from the data-- uncertainty, risk, emotional exposure.
translation.ja: データでは 不安定 リスク 感情の露呈

translation.en: So vulnerability is the feeling that we get when we feel uncertain, at risk, or emotionally exposed.
translation.ja: 無防備なときは 不安や危険 感情がむき出しな状態

translation.en: So I was doing work with special forces maybe a year ago now, and I asked a question.
translation.ja: １年ほど前に 特別部隊に質問した

translation.en: Could anyone, any one of the troops in this audience, give me an example of courage from their life
translation.ja: 自分 もしくは同胞の 勇敢な行動のうち―

translation.en: or something they witnessed in a colleague's life. A single example of courage
translation.ja: 不安やリスク 感情の露呈が 伴わなかったことが―

translation.en: that did not require uncertainty, risk, and emotional exposure,
translation.ja: 一度でもあったか

translation.en: and there was just silence.
translation.ja: 静粛に包まれた

translation.en: And I waited, and it seemed like a long time, and finally...
translation.ja: 長い間待った気がした

translation.en: a young man stood up and said, "Three tours, ma'am.
translation.ja: 若い兵士が立ち “３度戦場に行きました”

translation.en: There is no courage without vulnerability."
translation.ja: “勇気は無防備な 状態からでした”

translation.en: And so I would ask y'all, in here, give me a single example of courage
translation.ja: 皆さんにも聞きたい 自分や他の人がとった 勇敢な行為で―

translation.en: in your life or that you've witnessed in someone else's.
translation.ja: 自分や他の人がとった 勇敢な行為で―

translation.en: A single example of courage that did not require uncertainty, risk, or emotional exposure.
translation.ja: 不安 危険 感情の露呈が 伴わなかった時がある？

translation.en: I don't think you can.
translation.ja: ないでしょ

translation.en: There is no courage without vulnerability.
translation.ja: 無防備じゃないと 勇敢になれない

translation.en: Yet, how many were raised to believe that courage is an important value? That you should be brave with your life? Show of hands.
translation.ja: 勇敢であることは大事だと 教えられて育った人は？

translation.en: How many of you were raised to believe that vulnerability is weakness?
translation.ja: 無防備なのは 弱点だと教わった人は？

translation.en: Here's the rub. Be brave, but never put yourself out there.
translation.ja: 勇敢に　でもなるべく 傷つかないように

translation.en: We've gotta dispel the myth, right?
translation.ja: あり得ないでしょ

translation.en: Number two: "I don't do vulnerability."
translation.ja: ２番目は “無防備にはならない”

translation.en: Yes, you do.
translation.ja: ウソよ

translation.en: Anyone here manage to live to this point in your life without uncertainty, risk, or emotional exposure?
translation.ja: 今まで生きてきて不安や 危険を感じたことないの？

translation.en: No. We do vulnerability. And here's the thing.
translation.ja: 無防備になっている

translation.en: You only have two options. There's-- You only have two options.
translation.ja: 選択は２つのみ

translation.en: You do vulnerability knowingly, -or vulnerability does you. -[audience laughs]
translation.ja: 自ら無防備になるか 突然 襲われるか

translation.en: Vulnerability shows up, and you-- and if you don't know, just go home...
translation.ja: その時が来たら 家に戻り―

translation.en: and say, "Hey, do you think I do vulnerability well?" to someone you love, and then step back a couple steps...
translation.ja: ちゃんと無防備になれてるか 家族にきいてみて

translation.en: -[audience laughs] -...and take in the truth.
translation.ja: 真実を受け止めるの

translation.en: You do vulnerability, knowingly or unknowingly.
translation.ja: 知らなくても関わる事になる

translation.en: And here's the thing. Here's why we need it.
translation.ja: だからこそ必要なの

translation.en: Man, it is so much easier to cause pain than feel pain.
translation.ja: 傷つくより 傷つける方が楽だから

translation.en: And people are taking their pain and they're working it out on other people.
translation.ja: 人は心の傷を 他人に向けている

translation.en: And when you don't acknowledge your vulnerability, you work your shit out on other people.
translation.ja: 自分のもろさを認識しないと 他の人を攻撃する

translation.en: Stop working your shit out on other people.
translation.ja: 八つ当たりしないで

translation.en: Right? Stop.
translation.ja: やめなさい

translation.en: It's okay if you've got crazy stuff going on. Join the club.
translation.ja: 自分の人生が メチャクチャでも

translation.en: Like we all do.
translation.ja: みんなそう

translation.en: The difference is, don't offload your hard stuff on other people.
translation.ja: でも他の人に 八つ当たりしてはいけない

translation.en: Three: "I can go it alone." This was my favorite.
translation.ja: ３番目は “自分で何とかする”

translation.en: One time after a talk, a guy came up to me and goes,
translation.ja: 講演の後 男の人が来て―

translation.en: "I'm gonna try it. I'm gonna try vulnerability...
translation.ja: “試すよ 無防備になってみる”

translation.en: ...but I'm gonna try it by myself.
translation.ja: “自分１人で”

translation.en: And I'm gonna see how it goes, and then I'm gonna try it with other people."
translation.ja: “それから 他の人とも試してみる”

translation.en: And I was like,
translation.ja: 私は言った

translation.en: "I-- I don't think that's gonna work. Like, I don't know what that means."
translation.ja: “たぶん無理よ それ どういうこと？”

translation.en: And he's like,
translation.ja: 彼は―

translation.en: "I'm just gonna...
translation.ja: “１人で 無防備になってみる”

translation.en: do it alone for a while." And I was like, "All right, you get back to me."
translation.ja: “１人で 無防備になってみる” “うまくいったら教えて”

translation.en: We can't go it alone. We're neurobiologically hardwired
translation.ja: １人ではムリ 人間は神経生物学的に 人とつながりを求める

translation.en: for connection with other people.
translation.ja: 人間は神経生物学的に 人とつながりを求める

translation.en: In the absence of connection, love, and belonging, there is always suffering.
translation.ja: 愛やつながりがないと 必ず惨めになる

translation.en: You can't go it alone.
translation.ja: １人ではムリ

translation.en: If you could, I would have found a way by now.
translation.ja: できるならもうしてる

translation.en: As an introvert...
translation.ja: 私は内向的で 人間愛はあるけど―

translation.en: and somebody who loves humanity but is más o menos on people...
translation.ja: 私は内向的で 人間愛はあるけど― 人があまり好きじゃないから 本当はそうしたい

translation.en: -[audience laughs] -...I would have found a way.
translation.ja: 人があまり好きじゃないから 本当はそうしたい

translation.en: Number four: "You can engineer the uncertainty and discomfort out of vulnerability."
translation.ja: ４番目は“無防備でも 不安や不快は取り除ける”

translation.en: I work a lot with tech companies in Silicon Valley and around the world,
translation.ja: シリコンバレーや世界の ＩＴ会社の指導をする

translation.en: and they really want to engineer
translation.ja: 彼らは何とか― 不都合を無防備な状態から 取り除きたがる

translation.en: the uncomfortable part out of vulnerability,
translation.ja: 不都合を無防備な状態から 取り除きたがる

translation.en: to the point where one of them said, "We're thinking about an algorithm...
translation.ja: “今アルゴリズムを 考えている”

translation.en: -[audience laughs] -...that could actually help you predict when it's okay to be vulnerable with other people."
translation.ja: “いつ人と無防備になれるか 予測してくれる”

translation.en: And I was like, "The minute it becomes comfortable, it's no longer vulnerability.
translation.ja: 私は “快適になったら 無防備ではない”

translation.en: Call it whatever you want, but don't use that name on your app."
translation.ja: アプリには違う名前をつけて

translation.en: "Trust comes before vulnerability." This is a hard one, right?
translation.ja: “まず信用すること” これは難しい

translation.en: Like, do I trust you then I'm vulnerable with you?
translation.ja: 信用できないと 無防備になれない？

translation.en: Or am I vulnerable with you, and then I learn to trust you?
translation.ja: それとも無防備だから 信用できる？

translation.en: And the answer is "yes and..."
translation.ja: どっちも正しい

translation.en: It's a slow stacking over time of vulnerability and trust.
translation.ja: 時間をかけて 両方積み重ねていく

translation.en: We don't go out with, like, you know, the big guns, and like,
translation.ja: 知らない人に こうは言わないでしょ

translation.en: "Nice to meet you. I'm Brené. Here's my darkest secret. Can I trust you forever?"
translation.ja: “これが私の秘密よ 信用してもいい？”

translation.en: We start with little things, and we build over time, and the more I share with you, and the more you honor that sharing.
translation.ja: そうではなく 小さな事から 時間をかけて共有していく

translation.en: But here's the thing...
translation.ja: 大事なのは―

translation.en: you share with people who've earned the right to hear your story.
translation.ja: 聞く権利のある人に話す

translation.en: Your story is a privilege to hear.
translation.ja: 名誉なことだから

translation.en: You share it with people who've earned the right to hear it.
translation.ja: 聞かせる価値のある人に

translation.en: You don't share it... just because.
translation.ja: 誰とでも 共有するわけではない

translation.en: Vulnerability minus boundaries: not vulnerability.
translation.ja: 限度のない無防備は 無防備ではない

translation.en: Last: "Vulnerability is disclosure." This goes back to the boundary thing.
translation.ja: “無防備とは全面開示” これも違う

translation.en: Live Tweeting your bikini wax: not vulnerability.
translation.ja: 脱毛の生中継は 無防備になるのと違う

translation.en: Sharing the intimate details of your divorce and your pain on Facebook
translation.ja: 離婚の詳細や痛みを 投稿して―

translation.en: for your kids to read, who are reeling as well: not vulnerability.
translation.ja: 傷ついている子供に あらわにするのも違う

translation.en: Again, vulnerability minus boundaries is not vulnerability,
translation.ja: 限度がないのは 無防備ではない

translation.en: and you don't measure vulnerability by the amount of disclosure.
translation.ja: 開示する量で 測るものではない

translation.en: You measure it by the amount of courage to show up and be seen
translation.ja: 結果を左右できないのに― 自分をさらけだす 勇気によって測る

translation.en: when you can't control the outcome. Does that make sense?
translation.ja: 自分をさらけだす 勇気によって測る

translation.en: Okay, we're gonna end with a story.
translation.ja: 最後にこの話を

translation.en: So, Ellen, my daughter, decides to try swim team, and she tries--
translation.ja: 娘のエレンが 水泳チームに入った １年間 オフシーズンなしで大変

translation.en: She decides to try a year-round swim team,
translation.ja: １年間 オフシーズンなしで大変

translation.en: which is a big commitment 'cause we have a rule in our house that if you try a sport, you've gotta finish the season.
translation.ja: 家族の規則で 始めたらやめられない

translation.en: So she-- I'm picking her up one day from swim team practice,
translation.ja: 練習の後 迎えに行った

translation.en: and she's-- she's young. She's probably...
translation.ja: その頃あの子は５年生

translation.en: maybe fifth grade, and I can see-- How many of you have had this experience?
translation.ja: その頃あの子は５年生 あからさまに分かる

translation.en: I can see from her silhouette in front of me
translation.ja: あからさまに分かる 遠くから見ても シルエットで泣いているのが

translation.en: when I'm still eight cars behind that she's crying.
translation.ja: 遠くから見ても シルエットで泣いているのが

translation.en: Like, I can tell by the way she's holding her body that things are not okay.
translation.ja: 身体の動きで 悲しみが伝わってきた

translation.en: So I get up next to her. She gets in the car, and she's crying, and I said,
translation.ja: 車に乗ると やっぱり泣いていた 私は聞いた

translation.en: "What's wrong? What happened? What's going on?" She goes,
translation.ja: “何があったの？”

translation.en: "I have to swim the 100 breaststroke in the meet this weekend."
translation.ja: “今週末 平泳ぎ100mの競技がある”

translation.en: And I'm thinking to myself, "No! Not the 100 breaststroke!"
translation.ja: 私は思った　“最悪！”

translation.en: And I was like, "Man, that's a tough race."
translation.ja: “厳しいレースね”

translation.en: And she goes, "Mom, you know." And I was like,
translation.ja: 娘は “でしょ？”

translation.en: "That's a tough race, girl." And-- And here's the thing.
translation.ja: “確かにそうね” 平泳ぎは難しい

translation.en: Breaststroke is a hard stroke.
translation.ja: 平泳ぎは難しい

translation.en: It's like, one day it just comes together, and you get it.
translation.ja: ある日突然身に付く

translation.en: And like, the arms work with the frog legs, and it just happens.
translation.ja: 腕の動きと足の蹴りが 一体化する

translation.en: But until then, while you're doing it, you actually don't propel forward.
translation.ja: でもそれまでは前に進まない

translation.en: Like, when you don't-- You kinda go forward, then you come back, and then you go--
translation.ja: 前に進んでは後ろに下がる

translation.en: And so, 100 yards is a long way for non-propelling.
translation.ja: 前進しないと 100mでも時間がかかる

translation.en: I'm dying on the inside 'cause, you know, like,
translation.ja: 気持ちは痛いほど分かる

translation.en: I wasn't a great swimmer either, and I had those moments,
translation.ja: 私も大した 水泳選手ではなかった

translation.en: and, like, what I want to say is, "Well, run away and don't worry about it."
